sections.MISSION:
1/2CR Reconnaissance Platoon conducts M4 long range marksmanship day familiarization on 17 May 2024 on RG 114 to build confidence in primary weapon systems and improve combat readiness.

sections.PURPOSE: of this range is to provide the Reconnaissance Platoon with the opportunity to participate in long range marksmanship training.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Confirm Zero
Conduct stand off and holds
Conduct LRM Modified qualification
sections.END STATE:
The Reconnaissance Platoon successfully conducts long range marksmanship training during the day. Each soldier within the platoon will gain increased confidence in their primary weapon system.
Training Objectives
Conduct dry fire and range classes
Confirm M4 zero
Conduct long range practice fire
Confirm stand offs and holds on moving targets
Conduct long range modified qualification

values: PLT will move together to increase accountability and control. Everyone will receive a route brief and conduct vehicle battle drills IOT help mitigate risks of traveling to the Range. draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be medium as a result of an seldom probability of a critical event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to an unlikely probability of a critical event with control measures in place .Most Dangerous Risk: Negligent DischargeMitigation: Soldier will use selector switch discipline and only place the weapon system on fire prior to engaging targets. Upon completion of each engagement, selector switches will be placed on safe. Safeties will control the direction and safety for each shooter. Most Likely Risk: Slips, Trips, and FallsMitigation: Ensuring proper PPE is worn during operations and slowing down any nonessential movement. Part of the mitigation will be to brief about weather conditions and empower soldiers to modify any surface deem unsafe before and during the training event. Moving a controlled rate in order to prevent slips, trips, and falls.
